laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal epidermis with a few ectatic vessels in the papillary dermis, GLUT-1 antibody reacted with endothelial cells of the ectatic vessels.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Remained unchanged at follow-up at 2 years of age.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Ectatic vessels in the papillary and superficial reticular dermis without signs of active proliferation or lobular pattern, GLUT-1 antibody stained endothelial cells.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Lesion remained unchanged at last follow-up at 10 months of age.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Ectatic vessels observed in the papillary and reticular dermis, lobules of capillaries seen in the reticular dermis and subcutis, positive GLUT-1 immunostaining.
Superficial ectatic vessels and deep lobules of capillary vessels with positive GLUT-1 immunostaining.
